</TD><TD style="margin-top:0px; padding-left:9.6px; padding-top:0px; padding-right:9.6px; padding-bottom:0px" valign=top width=95.4><P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-9.6px" align=center>64</P>
</TD><TD style="margin-top:0px; padding-left:9.6px; padding-top:0px; padding-right:9.6px; padding-bottom:0px" valign=top width=164.4><P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-9.6px">December 2003</P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD style="margin-top:0px; padding-left:9.6px; padding-top:0px; padding-right:9.6px; padding-bottom:0px" valign=top width=164.4><P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-9.6px">Victor A. Yates &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)(4)</P>
</TD><TD style="margin-top:0px; padding-left:9.6px; padding-top:0px; padding-right:9.6px; padding-bottom:0px" valign=top width=164.4><P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-9.6px">Director</P>
</TD><TD style="margin-top:0px; padding-left:9.6px; padding-top:0px; padding-right:9.6px; padding-bottom:0px" valign=top width=95.4><P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-9.6px" align=center>71</P>
</TD><TD style="margin-top:0px; padding-left:9.6px; padding-top:0px; padding-right:9.6px; padding-bottom:0px" valign=top width=164.4><P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-9.6px">November 1987</P>
</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-9.6px; font-size:8pt">(1) &nbsp;Member of Audit Committee</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-9.6px; font-size:8pt">(2) &nbsp;Business Address: c/o Barrier Technology Inc. 510 4th Street North, Watkins, Minnesota, USA &nbsp;55389</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-9.6px; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;He spends full time on the affairs of the Company.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-9.6px; font-size:8pt">(3) &nbsp;Business Address: c/o Barrier Technology Corp. &nbsp;510 4th Street North, Watkins, Minnesota, USA &nbsp;55389</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-9.6px; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;She spends less than 10% of her time on the affairs of the Company.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-38.4px; font-size:8pt">(4) &nbsp;Member of the Compensation Committee</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-9.6px; font-size:8pt">(5) &nbsp;Business Address: c/o Barrier Technology Inc. &nbsp;510 4th Street North, Watkins, Minnesota, USA &nbsp;55389</P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-size:8pt" align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;She spends full time on the affairs of the Company.</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><I>David J. Corcoran</I>, Director, is a former Chartered Accountant and a former member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants in British Columbia, Canada, with over thirty years of experience in industry and commerce. &nbsp;Prior to 1976, Mr. Corcoran spent over five years gaining experience in marketing, sales and product distribution while he worked in sales with several major companies including Scott Paper and Bristol Myers. &nbsp;His career in accounting began in 1976 when he joined Touche Ross and Company. &nbsp;In 1979, he founded Corcoran and Company, Chartered Accountants. &nbsp;From 1979 to 1990, his firm secured a wide variety of business clients whom he advised regarding their management and business planning. &nbsp;In 1991, he joined the management of the Company on a full-time basis. &nbsp;Mr. Corcoran brings to the organization specific business experience in both sales and public finance. &nbsp;He has been an officer and director of the Company since it inception in 1986 up until he stepped down from Chief Financial Officer effective 11-30-2012.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center>40</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="margin:0px; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><I>Michael D. Huddy</I>, President/CEO and Director, joined the Company in February 1993 as President of the newly-formed US Subsidiary, Barrier Technology Corporation. &nbsp;Dr. Huddy was elected President/CEO of the Company and a Director in July 1994. &nbsp;Dr. Huddy had been in charge of marketing and sales of Blazeguard<FONT style="font-family:'Symbol'">&#226;</FONT> with Citadel and Weyerhaeuser. &nbsp;He was part of Weyerhaeuser&#146;s research/development team established to develop the Blazeguard<FONT style="font-family:'Symbol'">&#226;</FONT> product. &nbsp;Dr. Huddy brings sales, marketing and general management experience. &nbsp;He joined Weyerhaeuser&#146;s Architectural Products Group in 1988, after two years as General Manager of Weyerhaeuser&#146;s Northwest Hardwoods operations in Wisconsin. &nbsp;Before joining Weyerhaeuser, Dr. Huddy worked for Crown Zellerbach Corporation for seven years. &nbsp;Dr. Huddy holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Biological Sciences with a minor in Chemistry from Lake Superior State College; a Masters of Science degree in Resource Administration; and a Ph.D. in Natural Resource Economics with a minor in Business Management from Michigan State University.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><I>Melissa McElwee</I>, Chief Financial Officer, Ms. McElwee joined Barrier in 2003 as the Financial Services Manager for the USA operations where she was responsible for accounting, internal sales, and human resources.&nbsp; She is the General Operations Manager for Barrier.&nbsp; Ms. McElwee is responsible for customer relations, financial management, and production management for the company.&nbsp; She has a strong background in communication, financial analysis, and management.&nbsp; Prior to Barrier, Ms. McElwee held various managerial roles at Principal Financial Group in Iowa.&nbsp; She lead a team of project analysts responsible for developing and maintaining computer programs designed to efficiently process required IRS compliance testing for over 10,000 qualified retirement plans.&nbsp; In addition, Ms. McElwee facilitated external client presentations and internal training programs.&nbsp; Ms. McElwee holds a B.S. in Finance from Iowa State University in Ames, IA.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><I>Lindsey Nauen</I>, Corporate Secretary, received her MBA from the University of Minnesota in 1988. &nbsp;She also received a B.A. in psychology in 1971 and a M.A. in Library Science in 1974. &nbsp;She recently sold her business of over 15 years, Nauen Mobile Accounting, which provided accounting and business consulting services to small businesses. &nbsp;She remains as a consultant. &nbsp;She has been providing various accounting services to the Company since 1999.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><I>Victor A. Yates</I>, Director, is a self-employed businessman involved in real estate, construction of multi-family and commercial developments. &nbsp;He holds a degree in Real Estate Appraisal and is a Licensed Real Estate Agent. &nbsp;He has 30 years experience in operating a variety of business ventures brings to the Board an entrepreneurial and construction and financial perspective.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The Directors have served in their respective capacities since their election and/or appointment and will serve until the next Annual General Meeting or until a successor is duly elected, unless the office is vacated in accordance with the Articles/By-Laws of the Company.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The Executive Officers serve at the pleasure of the Board of Directors with management service contracts but without term of office.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Despite the Company&#146;s Secretary/Administrator spending material portions of this time on businesses other than the Company, the Company believes that she devotes sufficient time to the Company to properly carry out his duties.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>No Director and/or Executive Officer has been the subject of any order, judgment, or decree of any governmental agency or administrator or of any court or competent jurisdiction, revoking or suspending for cause any license, permit or other authority of such person or of any corporation of which he is a Director and/or Executive Officer, to engage in the securities business or in the sale of a particular security or temporarily or permanently restraining or enjoining any such person or any corporation of which he is an officer or director from engaging in or continuing any conduct, practice, or employment in connection with the purchase or sale of securities, or convicting such person of any felony or misdemeanor involving a security or any aspect of the securities business or of theft or of any felony.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>There are no arrangements or understandings between any two or more Directors or Executive Officers, pursuant to which he was selected as a Director or Executive Officer. &nbsp;There are no family relationships between any two or more Directors or Executive Officers.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><U>Board of Director Practices</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>All directors hold office until the next meeting of the shareholders of the Company unless they resign or are removed in accordance with the Company&#146;s Articles. &nbsp;Officers are appointed to serve at the discretion of the Board of Directors. &nbsp;The Board of Directors and Committees of the Board schedule regular meetings over the course of the year.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center>41</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="margin:0px; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The fundamental objective of the Board is to ensure that it operates in a fashion that maximizes shareholder value over the long term. &nbsp;The Board&#146;s duties and responsibilities are all carried out in a manner consistent with that fundamental objective. &nbsp;The principal duty and responsibility of the Board is to oversee the management and operations of the Company, with the day-to-day management of the business and affairs of the Company delegated by the Board to the CEO and other Executive Officers.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The Board&#146;s responsibilities include overseeing the conduct of the Company&#146;s business, providing leadership and direction to its management, and setting policies. &nbsp;Strategic direction for the Company is developed through the Board&#146;s annual planning process. &nbsp;Through this process, the Board adopts the operating plan for the coming year, and monitors management&#146;s progress relative to that plan through a regular reporting and review process.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The Board has delegated to the President/Chief Executive Officer and the Executive Officers responsibility for the day-to-day management of the business of the Company. &nbsp;Matters of policy and issues outside the normal course of business are brought before the Board for its review and approval, along with all matters dictated by statute and legislation requiring Board review and approval. &nbsp;The President/CEO and the Executive Officers review the Company&#146;s progress in relation to the current operating plan at in-person Board meetings. &nbsp;The Board meets on a regular basis with and without management present. &nbsp;Financial, operational and strategic issues facing the Company are reviewed, monitored and approved at the Board meetings.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><B><U>Compliance with Section 16(a) of the Exchange Act</U></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The Board of Directors, all Officers, and major shareholders of 10% or more of International Barrier Technology Inc. are in compliance with all reporting requirements of the Exchange Act. </P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><B><U>Code of Ethics</U></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The Company has not adopted a written &#147;code of ethics&#148; that meets the new United States' Sarbanes-Oxley standards; the Board of Directors believes that existing Canadian standards and procedures is adequate for its purposes. &nbsp;The Company has not seen any need to adopt a written code of ethics on the basis that its corporate culture effectively deters wrongdoing and promotes honest and ethical conduct, full, fair and accurate, timely, and understandable disclosure in reports and documents, the compliance with applicable governmental laws, rules and regulations; the prompt internal reporting of violations of the code; and accountability for adherence to the code.</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><B><U>Corporate Governance</U></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><U>Director Independence</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Pursuant to Item 407(a)(1)(ii) of Regulation S-K of the Securities Act, our Board of Directors has adopted standards for determining whether a director is independent from management. &nbsp;The Board reviews, consistent with the Company&#146;s corporate governance guidelines, whether a director has any material relationship with the Company that would impair the director&#146;s independent judgment. &nbsp;In summary, an independent director means a person other than an executive officer or employee or any other individual having a relationship which, in the opinion of our directors, would interfere with the exercise of independent judgment in carrying out the responsibilities of a director, and includes any director who accepts compensation from us exceeding $200,000 during any period of twelve consecutive months within the three past fiscal years. &nbsp;Owning shares of our common stock does not preclude a director from being independent. &nbsp;In applying this definition, our board determined that David Corcoran and Victor Yates are independent.</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Our board adopted and applied the same definition of independent director to the members of our audit committee. &nbsp;In applying this definition, our board determined that David Corcoran and Victor Yates qualify as an independent director for purposes of Section 10A(m)(3) of the Securities Exchange Act.</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><U>Board Meetings and Committees; Annual Meeting Attendance</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>During Fiscal 2016, the Board of Directors held four regularly scheduled meetings, and eight special and telephone meetings. &nbsp;For various reasons, Board members may not be able to attend a Board meeting; all Board members are provided information related to each of the agenda items before each meeting, and, therefore, can provide counsel outside the confines of regularly scheduled meetings. &nbsp;No director attended fewer than 75% of the aggregate of: (1) the total number of meetings of the Board of Directors, while he was a Director; and (2) the total number of meetings of committees of the Board of Directors on which the director served. &nbsp;Directors are encouraged to attend annual meetings of our stockholder; all three directors physically attended the December 2015 annual shareholders meeting.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center>42</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>

</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><U>Nominating Committee and Compensation Advisory Board</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The Company does not have a Nominating Committee. &nbsp;The entire Board of Directors is responsible for screening potential director candidates and recommending qualified candidates for nomination as members of the Board of Directors. In evaluating potential director candidates, the Board of Directors considers recommendations of potential candidates from incumbent directors, management and stockholders. &nbsp;Any recommendation submitted by a stockholder to the Board of Directors must include the same information concerning the potential candidate and the stockholder, and must be received in the time frame described herein for the Calendar 2016 Annual meeting.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The Company has a Compensation Advisory Board (&#147;Advisory Board&#148;). &nbsp;The Advisory Board consists of David Corcoran, Victor Yates and Martin Lizt. &nbsp;The Advisory Board is responsible for the compensation of the Company&#146;s executive officers and to administer all incentive compensation plans and equity-based plans of the Company, including the plans under which Company securities may be acquired by directors, executive officers, employees and consultants.</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><U>Audit Committee</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The Company has an Audit Committee, which recommends to the Board of Directors the engagement of the independent auditors of the Company and reviews with the independent auditors the scope and results of the Company&#146;s audits, the Company&#146;s internal accounting controls, and the professional services furnished by the independent auditors to the Company. &nbsp;The current members of the Audit Committee are: David Corcoran, Mike Huddy and Victor Yates (independent). &nbsp;The Audit Committee met monthly in Fiscal 2016 and has met three times during Fiscal 2017-to-date. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The Company does not have an &#147;audit committee financial expert&#148; serving on its Audit Committee. &nbsp;The Company&#146;s Audit Committee consists of two independent directors and the Company&#146;s Chief Executive Officer, all of whom are financially literate and very knowledgeable about the Company&#146;s affairs. &nbsp;Because the Company&#146;s structure and operations are straightforward, the Company does not find it necessary to augment its Board with a financial expert.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The audit committee has:</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-28.8px" align=justify>a. reviewed and discussed the audited financial statements with management;</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-28.8px" align=justify>b. discussed with the independent auditors the matters required to be discussed by PCAOB Auditing Standard No. 16 (Communications with Audit Committees) </P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-28.8px" align=justify>c. received the written disclosures and the letter from the independent accountants required by as adopted by the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board in Rule 3526, and has discussed with the independent accountant the independent accountant's independence; and</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-28.8px" align=justify>d. recommended to the board of directors that the audited financial statements be included in the Company's annual report on Form 10&#150;K for the last fiscal year for filing with the SEC.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The Audit Committee recommends to the Board of Directors the engagement of the independent auditors of the Company and reviews with the independent auditors the scope and results of the Company&#146;s audits, the Company&#146;s internal accounting controls, and the professional services furnished by the independent auditors to the Company.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The Audit Committee is directly responsible for the appointment, compensation and oversight of auditors; the audit committee has in place procedures for receiving complaints and concerns about accounting and auditing matters; and has the authority and the funding to engage independent counsel and other outside advisors.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The Audit Committee may delegate to one or more designated members of the Audit Committee the authority to grant pre-approvals required by this policy and procedure. &nbsp;The decisions of any Audit Committee member to whom authority is delegated to pre-approve a service shall be presented to the full Audit Committee at its next scheduled meeting.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center>43</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="margin:0px; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>In accordance with the requirements of the US Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 and rules issued by the Securities and Exchange Commission, we introduced a procedure for the review and pre-approval of any services performed by BDO including audit services, audit related services, tax services and other services. &nbsp;The procedure requires that all proposed engagements of BDO LLP for audit and permitted non-audit services are submitted to the audit committee for approval prior to the beginning of any such services.</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><U>Shareholder Communications With the Board</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Historically, the Company has adopted an informal process for stockholder communications with the Board by providing an email address and toll-free phone number available on the website: www.intlbarrier.com. &nbsp;Every effort has been made to ensure that the views of stockholders are heard by the Board, or individual directors as applicable, and that appropriate responses are provided to the stockholder in a timely manner. &nbsp;Stockholders wishing to communicate at any time with the Board of Directors, or a specific member of the Board, may do so by writing the Board or a specific member of the Board by delivering correspondence in person or by mail to: The Board of Directors, c/o Lindsey Nauen, Corporate Secretary, 510 4th Street North, Watkins, Minnesota &nbsp;55389. &nbsp;Communication(s) directed to the Board or a specific Board member will be relayed unopened to the intended Board member(s).</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Further, Directors&#146; attendance at Annual Meetings can provide shareholders with an opportunity to communicate with Directors about issues affecting the Company. &nbsp;The Company does not have a policy regarding director attendance, but all Directors are encouraged to attend the Annual Meeting of Shareholders. &nbsp;All of our directors physically attended our Annual Meeting in December 2015.</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<A NAME="_Toc431114180"></A><P style="margin:0px" align=justify><B><U>ITEM 11. &nbsp;EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION</U></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><U>Director Compensation</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The Company compensated Directors for their service in their capacity as Directors, $750 per physical meeting up until the decision was made at the November 30, 2012 Annual General Meeting. &nbsp;It was decided to discontinue this payment until further notice. &nbsp;During the 2014 Annual Meeting, it was decided to reinstate this compensation. &nbsp;Directors are entitled to reimbursement for reasonable travel and other out-of-pocket expenses incurred in connection with attendance at meetings of the Board of Directors. &nbsp;During the 2015 Annual General Meeting and after research on comparable compensation, it was decided to compensate the Board of Directors a $15,000 annual fee. The Board of Directors may award special remuneration to any Director undertaking any special services on behalf of the Company other than services ordinarily required of a Director. &nbsp;During Fiscal 2016/2015/2014, Directors were paid $3,000, $1,500, and $0 for attending meetings, respectively. During the year ended June 30, 2016, each member of the Board of Directors was granted a $30,000 bonus for the execution of the LP Building Products License agreement and $15,000 annual Board of Director compensation for the years ended June 30, 2015 and June 30, 2016.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><U>Executive Officer Compensation</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The following table sets forth the summary of compensation earned during Fiscal 2016 and Fiscal 2015 by the Company&#146;s Chief Executive Officer and its other named Executive Officers. &nbsp;The following table excludes Directors&#146; Fees paid to Executive Officers who are also Directors; refer to Table No. 6.</P>

<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-96px"><U>Director Compensation</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The following table sets forth the summary of compensation earned during Fiscal 2016 and Fiscal 2015 by the Company&#146;s Directors. &nbsp;For Executive Officers who are also Directors, this table includes only Directors Fees; refer to Table No. 5 for all other compensation for them.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<TABLE style="margin-top:0px; font-size:10pt" cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 align=center><TR height=0 style="font-size:0"><TD width=97.4 /><TD width=62.6 /><TD width=65.4 /><TD width=56 /><TD width=75.667 /><TD width=82.533 /><TD width=107.8 /><TD width=58.867 /><TD width=74.067 /></TR>

</TD></TR>

</TD></TR>
<TR><TD style="margin-top:0px; padding-left:9.6px; padding-top:0px; padding-right:9.6px; padding-bottom:0px; border-bottom:3px double #000000" valign=top width=680.333 colspan=9><P style="margin:0px" align=center>Directors</P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD style="margin-top:0px; padding-left:9.6px; padding-top:0px; padding-right:9.6px; padding-bottom:0px; border-left:3px double #000000; border-right:1px solid #000000; border-bottom:3px double #000000" valign=bottom width=97.4><P style="margin:0px; font-size:8pt"><B>Director </B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-size:8pt"><B>Name</B></P>

<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><U>Stock Options</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The Company grants stock options to Directors, Executive Officers and employees/consultants; refer to ITEM #11, &#147;Stock Options&#148; and Tables 5/6/7/8/9.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><U>Stock Options Granted/Expired During The Most Recently Completed Fiscal Year</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px">During the most recently completed fiscal year, there were no options granted to Executive Officers, Directors, employees/consultants. &nbsp;The Company has no equity or non-equity incentive plans. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>

<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><U>Option Exercises and Stock Vested</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>During Fiscal 2016 ended 6/30/2016, there were no exercises of stock options, no grants of stock options, and the Company made no stock awards.</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center>45</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="margin:0px; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><U>Michael Huddy, President/CEO; Written Management Agreement</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Michael Huddy provides his services pursuant to a management agreement dated 2/13/1993; the terms of the agreement have been revised although no new formal agreement has been signed. &nbsp;The current terms require that Mr. Huddy provide full-time service to Barrier in an executive capacity (CEO) and to be fully responsible for Barrier&#146;s activities in the USA. &nbsp;The original agreement was for a term of four years but was to renew automatically ever two years unless written notice of the intent to terminate was given by either party to the other. &nbsp;Terms of compensation are to be given prior to any renewal period.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The employment agreement specifies employer termination provisions including: material breach of any provision of the contract; inability to perform the duties under the agreement; fraud or serious neglect or misconduct; personal bankruptcy.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The duties are complete as to those of a Chief Executive Officer (President) and include: Administration of the day to day affairs of the Employer Development of Financial, manufacturing, and marketing plans; Communication with Employer and Shareholders on a timely basis; and, Formulation and execution of a proposed budget approved by the Employer. &nbsp;The Employment Agreement contains a Confidentiality Provision that precludes the sharing of confidential information to third parties not requiring the information to conduct business with Barrier. &nbsp;The confidentiality provision extends beyond the time limit of the agreement until the information or knowledge becomes part of the public domain.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><U>Change of Control Remuneration</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The Company has no plans or arrangements in respect of remuneration received or that may be received by Executive Officers of the Company in Fiscal 2016 to compensate such officers in the event of termination of employment (as a result of resignation, retirement, change of control) or a change of responsibilities following a change of control, where the value of such compensation exceeds $100,000 per Executive Officer.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><U>Bonus/Profit Sharing/Non-Cash Compensation</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Except for the compensation outlined in Item 7, the Company has no material bonus or profit sharing plans pursuant to which cash or non-cash compensation is paid to the Company's Directors or Executive Officers.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><U>Pension/Retirement Benefits</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>No funds were set aside or accrued by the Company during Fiscal 2016 to provide pension, retirement or similar benefits for Directors or Executive Officers.</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>

</TABLE>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The Company has adopted a rolling stock option plan (&#147;the 2005 Rolling Plan&#148;). &nbsp;The 2005 Rolling Plan provides for the granting of stock options to selected directors, officers, employees or consultants in an aggregate amount of up to 10% of the issued and outstanding common shares of the Company. &nbsp;Under the 2005 Rolling Plan, the granting of stock options, exercise prices and terms are determined by the Company's Board of Directors. Options granted to non-executive employees and consultants typically vest in stages over various periods of time while options granted to Directors and executive employees vest immediately upon their grant. The exercise price shall not be less than the Discounted Market Price, which is defined as the last closing price of the common shares before the date of the grant less an applicable discount, as allowed by the regulatory authorities. Options granted under the 2005 Rolling Plan may not exceed a term of 5 years unless the Company achieves classification as a &#147;Tier 1&#148; issuer in accordance with the policies of the TSX, in which case, the options may be granted for a maximum term of 10 years.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>

<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; font-size:8pt; float:left">(1)</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; font-size:8pt" align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Carl Marks IB LLC, Carl Marks &amp; Co. Inc., and Martin Lizt are collectively deemed to be a &#147;Group&#148; within the meaning of Section 13(g)(3) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended. &nbsp;Carl Marks IB LLC is a partnership of Carl Marks &amp; Co. LP and Martin Lizt. Andrew M. Boas and Robert Speer of New York, Limited Partners in Carl Marks &amp; Co. LP, exercise direction/control over Carl Marks IB LLC. &nbsp;Carl Marks &amp; Co. LP is a limited partnership of 18 partners. &nbsp;Carolyn Marks Blackwood and Linda Marks Katz are the two greater than 10% holders of the partnership. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; font-size:8pt; float:left">(2)</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; font-size:8pt" align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1,954,287 shares currently exercisable options (above) held indirectly through Corcoran Enterprises Ltd., a private company controlled by Mr. Corcoran. 42,807 shares are escrowed and contingently cancelable where release is controlled by Canadian regulatory authorities. The escrow shares are currently eligible for to be released to Mr. Corcoran but the Company has yet to request this release. &nbsp;Excludes 1,986,434 shares owned by family members, where he disavows beneficial interest and does not have voting or disposition control.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; font-size:8pt; float:left">(3)</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; font-size:8pt" align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1,429,772 shares currently exercisable options (above) held indirectly through Continental Appraisal Ltd., a private company controlled by Mr. Yates. &nbsp;6,115 shares are escrowed and contingently cancelable where release is controlled by Canadian regulatory authorities &nbsp;&nbsp;Excludes 1,751,551 shares owned by family members, where he disavows beneficial interest &nbsp;and does not have voting or disposition control.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-size:8pt" align=justify># Based on 48,884,926 shares outstanding as of 8/31/2016.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><B><U>Escrowed Common Shares</U></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>On 5/15/1987, the Company issued 296,500 shares of &#147;Principal Escrow&#148; common stock at CDN$0.01 per share. &nbsp;Effective 11/24/2004, 124,530 of these shares were cancelled and returned to the treasury. &nbsp;48,922 of these shares are still escrowed and outstanding. &nbsp;On 8/31/2016, these are held:</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Continental Appraisals Ltd.................................... &nbsp;&nbsp;6,115 shares</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Corcoran Enterprises Ltd...................................... &nbsp;42,807 shares</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Pursuant to a performance escrow agreement dated 2/24/1992 between the Company and certain escrow Shareholders (the &#147;Escrow Agreement&#148;), 48,922 common shares of the Company (the &#147;Escrow Shares&#148;) are held in escrow with Pacific Corporate Trust Company of Vancouver, British Columbia. &nbsp;The Escrow Shares are held by Corcoran Enterprises Ltd. (&#147;Corcoran&#148;), a private company owned by David Corcoran, a director of the Company and Continental Appraisals Ltd. (&#147;Continental&#148;), a private company owned by Victor Yates, a director of the Company.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center>48</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="margin:0px; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Pursuant to the terms of the Escrow Agreement, the Escrow Shares were to have been surrendered for cancellation on 2/24/2002; however, the Escrow Shares have not been cancelled. &nbsp;The Company has received acceptance in principle from the TSX Venture Exchange (&#147;TSX&#148;) to cancel the Escrow Shares not held by Officers/Director, and have the shares held by Officers/Directors reinstated and made subject to a TSX Tier 2 Surplus Escrow Agreement (the &#147;New Escrow Agreement&#148;) with a six-year time release formula (described below). &nbsp;Conversion of performance escrow shares to time release escrow shares, as contemplated, is permitted under TSX and British Columbia Securities Commission (&#147;BCSC&#148;) policies relating to escrow shares held under previous escrow regimes such as the BCSC&#146;s Local Policy Statement 3-07.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Final approval of the conversion to a time-release formula is, in the Company&#146;s case, subject to the Company obtaining shareholder approval for the reinstatement and conversion to time-release escrow and complying with all other applicable TSXV and BCSC policies related to the reinstatement and conversion.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Following approval by the Company&#146;s shareholders, the TSXV (12/9/2004), and the BCSC, the Company and the escrow shareholders entered into the New Escrow Agreement. &nbsp;Under the terms of the New Escrow Agreement, the Escrow Shares and will be released as follows:</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-134.4px" align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;5% (1/20 of total Escrow Shares) six months from date of TSXV Acceptance</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-134.4px" align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;5% (1/19 of remaining Escrow Shares) 12 months from TSXV Acceptance</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-134.4px" align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;5% (1/18 of remaining Escrow Shares) 18 months from TSXV Acceptance</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-134.4px" align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;5% (1/17 of remaining Escrow Shares) 24 months from TSXV Acceptance</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-134.4px" align=justify>&nbsp;10% (1/8 of remaining Escrow Shares) &nbsp;30 months from TSXV Acceptance</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-134.4px" align=justify>&nbsp;10% (1/7 of remaining Escrow Shares) &nbsp;36 months from TSXV Acceptance</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-134.4px" align=justify>&nbsp;10% (1/6 of remaining Escrow Shares) &nbsp;42 months from TSXV Acceptance</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-134.4px" align=justify>&nbsp;10% (1/5 of remaining Escrow Shares) &nbsp;48 months from TSXV Acceptance</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-134.4px" align=justify>&nbsp;10% (1/4 of remaining Escrow Shares) &nbsp;54 months from TSXV Acceptance</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-134.4px" align=justify>&nbsp;10% (1/3 of remaining Escrow Shares) &nbsp;60 months from TSXV Acceptance</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-134.4px" align=justify>&nbsp;10% (1/2 of remaining Escrow Shares) &nbsp;66 months from TSXV Acceptance</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-134.4px" align=justify>&nbsp;10% (all remaining Escrow Shares) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;72 months from TSXV Acceptance</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>If the Company becomes a Tier 1 issuer under the policies of the TSXV prior to the expiration of the 72-month release period set out above, the release schedule set out above will be amended to comply with the applicable Tier 1 release schedule, resulting in an accelerated release of any securities remaining in escrow, with such securities being released as if the Company had originally been classified as Tier 1 issuer. &nbsp;The securities of Tier 1 issuers held under surplus security escrow agreements are released over a three-year period, with 10% of the securities being released on TSX acceptance and 15% being released every six months thereafter.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Unless otherwise expressly permitted in the New Escrow Agreement, the Escrow Shares may not be sold, transferred, assigned, mortgaged or otherwise dealt with in any way. &nbsp;Pursuant to the terms of the New Escrow Agreement, the Escrow Shares may be transferred within escrow to an individual who is a director or senior officer of the Company or of a material operating subsidiary of the Company, subject to the approval of the Company&#146;s board of directors, or to a person or company that before the proposed transfer holds more than 20% of the voting rights attached to the Company&#146;s outstanding securities, or to a person or company that after the proposed transfer will hold more than 10% of the voting rights attached to the Company&#146;s outstanding securities and that has the right to elect or appoint one or more directors or senior officers of the Company or of any of its material operating subsidiaries. &nbsp;The Escrow Shares may also be pledged, mortgaged or charged to a financial institution as collateral for a loan. &nbsp;No Escrow Shares may be transferred or delivered to the financial institution for this purpose and the loan agreement must provide that the Escrow Securities will remain in escrow if the lender realizes on the security to satisfy the loan.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Pursuant to the terms of the New Escrow Agreement, upon the bankruptcy of an escrow shareholder, the Escrow Shares of that shareholder held in escrow may be transferred within escrow to the trustee in bankruptcy or other person legally entitled to such securities. &nbsp;Upon the death of an escrow shareholder, all securities of the deceased holder will be released from escrow to the deceased holder&#146;s legal representative.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Subject to certain limited exceptions, escrow shareholders retain all voting rights attached to their Escrow Shares. &nbsp;The New Escrow Agreement provides that the Escrow Shares will be cancelled if the asset, property or business in consideration of which the Escrow Shares were issued is lost or abandoned, or the operations or development of such asset, property or business is discontinued.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center>49</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="margin:0px; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>At the Annual Shareholders&#146; Meeting, 12/9/2004, disinterested shareholders approved an ordinary resolution authorizing the reinstatement of the Escrow Shares and the adoption of the New Escrow Agreement by the Company and the escrow shareholders. &nbsp;Disinterested shareholders for the purpose of voting on the resolution include all shareholders of the Company other than David Corcoran and Victor Yates, and their affiliates and associates. &nbsp;A total of 3,449,253 shares held by David Corcoran, Victor Yates, and their affiliates and associates, were therefore not be counted for the purpose of determining whether the required level of shareholder approval has been obtained.</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><B><U>Securities authorized for issuance under equity compensation plans.</U></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px">&nbsp;--- No Disclosure Necessary ---</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><B><U>Stock Options</U></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The terms of incentive options granted by the Company are done in accordance with the rules and policies of the TSX Venture Exchange, including the number of common shares under option, the exercise price and expiry date of such options, and any amendments thereto. &nbsp;The Company adopted a formal written stock option plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;) on 12/12/2003.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Such &#147;terms and conditions&#148;, including the pricing of the options, expiry and the eligibility of personnel for such stock options; and are described below.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><U>Number of Shares Reserved</U>. &nbsp;The number of common shares that may be issued pursuant to options granted under the Plan may not exceed 10% of the issued and outstanding shares of the Company from time to time at the date of granting of options (including all options granted by the Company under the Plan).</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><U>Maximum Term of Options</U>. &nbsp;The term of any options granted under the Plan is fixed by the Board of Directors and may not exceed five years from the date of grant, or ten years if the Company is classified as a &#147;Tier 1&#148; issuer under the policies of the TSX Venture Exchange. &nbsp;The options are non-assignable and non-transferable.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><U>Exercise Price</U>. &nbsp;The exercise price of options granted under the Plan is determined by the Board of Directors, provided that it is not less than the discounted market price, as that term is defined in the TSX Venture Exchange policy manual or such other minimum price as is permitted by the TSX Venture Exchange in accordance with the policies from time to time, or, if the shares are no longer listed on the TSX Venture Exchange, then such other exchange or quotation system on which the shares are listed or quoted for trading.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><U>Reduction of Exercise Price</U>. &nbsp;The exercise price of stock options granted to insiders may not be decreased without disinterested shareholder approval, as described below.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><U>Termination</U>. &nbsp;Any options granted pursuant to the Plan will terminate generally within 90 days of the option holder ceasing to act as a director, officer, or employee of the Company or any of its affiliates, and within generally 30 days of the option holder ceasing to act as an employee engaged in investor relations activities, unless such cessation is on account of death. &nbsp;If such cessation is on account of death, the options terminate on the first anniversary of such cessation. &nbsp;If such cessation is on account of cause, or terminated by regulatory sanction or by reason of judicial order, the options terminate immediately. &nbsp;Options that have been cancelled or that have expired without having been exercised shall continue to be issuable under the Plan. &nbsp;The Plan also provides for adjustments to outstanding options in the event of any consolidation, subdivision, conversion or exchange of Company&#146;s shares.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><U>Administration</U>. The Plan is administered by the Board of Directors of the Company or senior officer or employee to which such authority is delegated by the Board from time to time.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><U>Board Discretion</U>. The Plan provides that, generally, the number of shares subject to each option, the exercise price, the expiry time, the extent to which such option is exercisable, including vesting schedules, and other terms and conditions relating to such options shall be determined by the Board of Directors of the Company or senior officer or employee to which such authority is delegated by the Board from time to time and in accordance with TSX Venture Exchange policies. &nbsp;The number of option grants, in any twelve-month period, may not result in the issuance to any one optionee which exceed 5% of the outstanding common shares of the Company (unless the Company is a Tier 1 issuer and has obtained the requisite disinterested shareholder approval), or the issuance to a consultant or an employee engaged in investor relations activities which exceed 2% of the outstanding common shares of the Company. &nbsp;Disinterested shareholder approval will be sought in respect of any material amendment to the Plan.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center>50</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="margin:0px; page-break-before:always"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The names of the Directors/Senior Management/employees/consultants of the Company to whom outstanding stock options have been granted and the number of common shares subject to such options is set forth in the following table, as well as the total number of options outstanding.</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<TABLE style="margin-top:0px; font-size:10pt" cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 align=center><TR height=0 style="font-size:0"><TD width=625.8 /></TR>
<TR><TD style="margin-top:0px; padding-left:9.6px; padding-top:0px; padding-right:9.6px; padding-bottom:0px; border-bottom:1px solid #000000" valign=top width=625.8><P style="margin:0px" align=center>Table No. 10</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center>Stock Options Outstanding</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center>August 31, 2016</P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD style="margin-top:0px; padding-left:9.6px; padding-top:0px; padding-right:9.6px; padding-bottom:0px; border-bottom:1px solid #000000" valign=top width=625.8><P style="margin:0px">There are no outstanding stock options.</P>
</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<A NAME="_Toc431114182"></A><P style="margin:0px" align=justify><B><U>ITEM 13. &nbsp;CERTAIN RELATIONSHIPS AND RELATED TRANSACTIONS</U></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><U>David Corcoran, Administrator/Director</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:1.2px" align=justify>During the twelve months ended June 30, 2012, the Company issued a convertible debenture to a company controlled by Mr. Corcoran in the amount of $150,000. The Company is drawing on this debenture in tranches of between $10,000-50,000 and as of June 30, 2016, the company had received $110,000 in respect of this debenture. &nbsp;The debenture bears interest at 12% per annum and is secured by a third charge over the Company&#146;s plant and equipment as well as charge against the Company&#146;s patents. &nbsp;At any time, the notes are convertible into units of the Company at a price of $0.10 per unit. &nbsp;Each unit will consist of one common share and one common share purchase warrant entitling the holder thereof to purchase an additional share for $0.10 for a period of two years from the conversion date. &nbsp;The convertible debenture expires January 2017.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><U>Michael Huddy, President/CEO</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:1.2px" align=justify>During the twelve months ended June 30, 2012, the Company issued a convertible debenture to a company controlled by Mr. Huddy, director, in the amount of $150,000. The Company is drawing on this debenture in tranches of between $10,000-50,000 and as of June 30, 2016, the company had received $130,000 in respect of this debenture. &nbsp;The debenture bears interest at 12% per annum and is secured by a third charge over the Company&#146;s plant and equipment as well as charge against the Company&#146;s patents. &nbsp;At any time, the notes are convertible into units of the Company at a price of $0.10 per unit. &nbsp;Each unit will consist of one common share and one common share purchase warrant entitling the holder thereof to purchase an additional share for $0.10 for a period of two years from the conversion date. &nbsp;The convertible debenture expires January 2017.</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Other than described above, there have been no transactions since 6/30/2012, or proposed transactions, which have materially affected or will materially affect the Company in which any Director, Executive Officer, or beneficial holder of more than 10% of the outstanding common stock, or any of their respective relatives, spouses, associates or affiliates has had or will have any direct or material indirect interest.</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<A NAME="_Toc431114183"></A><P style="margin:0px" align=justify><B><U>ITEM 14. &nbsp;PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTANT FEES AND SERVICES</U></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Professional accounting services were rendered by BDO Canada LLP for Fiscal 2016 and Fiscal 2015.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><U>Audit Fees</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The aggregate fees billed for professional services rendered by the Company&#146;s principal accountant for the audit of the Company&#146;s annual financial statements incurred in the fiscal years ended 6/30/2016 and 6/30/2015 were $71,799 and $63,927 respectively.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><U>Audit Related Fees</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The Company incurred no audit related fees during fiscal years ended 6/30/2016 and 6/30/2015.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><U>Tax Fees</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The Company incurred no tax fees for the fiscal years ended 6/30/2016 and 6/30/2015 in respect of professional services rendered by the Company&#146;s principal accountant for tax compliance, tax advice and tax planning.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><U>All Other Fees</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The Company incurred no other fees during the last two fiscal years for services rendered by the Company&#146;s principal accountant.</P>

<TITLE>Consent - Form 10-K or Form 8-K</TITLE>
<META NAME="author" CONTENT="Karin Blaney">
<META NAME="date" CONTENT="2015-09-22T22:10:00Z">
</HEAD>
<BODY style="margin-top:0;font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:10pt; color:#000000">
<P style="margin-top:13.333px; margin-bottom:0px; font-family:'Trebuchet MS,Times New Roman'" align=justify>Exhibit 23</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Trebuchet MS,Times New Roman'; font-size:10.5pt" align=center><U>Consent of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm</U></P>
<P style="margin-top:16px; margin-bottom:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:14px; margin-bottom:0px; font-family:'Trebuchet MS,Times New Roman'; font-size:10.5pt" align=justify>We hereby consent to the incorporation by reference in the Registration Statement on Form S&#173;8 (No. 333-166306) of International Barrier Technology Inc. of our report dated September 28, 2016, relating to the consolidated financial statements which appears in this Form<FONT style="font-family:'Arial'"> </FONT>10-K. </P>
<P style="line-height:13pt; margin:0px"><BR></P>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-31
<SEQUENCE>4
<FILENAME>ex311.htm
<DESCRIPTION>CERTIFICATION
<TEXT>
<!doctype html public "-//IETF//DTD HTML//EN">
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>EXHIBIT 31</TITLE>
<META NAME="author" CONTENT="Barbara ">
<META NAME="date" CONTENT="09/25/2015">
</HEAD>
<BODY style="margin-top:0;font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:10pt; color:#000000">
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'"><B>EXHIBIT 31.1</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=center><B>Certification of Chief Executive Officer </B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=center><B>Pursuant to Section 302 (a) of the US Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'">I, <U>Michael Huddy</U>, certify that:</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; float:left">1.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'">I have reviewed this Annual Report on Form 10-K of</P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; clear:left"><U>International Barrier Technology Inc.</U>;</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; float:left">2.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; float:left">3.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; float:left">4.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; clear:left; float:left">a.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; clear:left; float:left">b.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; clear:left; float:left">c.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; clear:left; float:left">d.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#146;s most recent fiscal quarter that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting; and</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; float:left">5.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#146;s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#146;s Board of Directors:</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; clear:left; float:left">a.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>all significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; clear:left; float:left">b.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'">Date: September 28, 2016</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'"><U>/s/ Michael Huddy</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'">Michael Huddy</P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'">President and Chief Executive Officer</P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'">(Principal Executive Officer)</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR>
<BR></P>
</BODY>

<BODY style="margin-top:0;font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:10pt; color:#000000">
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'"><B>EXHIBIT 31.2</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=center><B>Certification of Chief Financial Officer </B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=center><B>Pursuant to Section 302 (a) of the US Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'">I, <U>Melissa McElwee</U>, certify that:</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; float:left">1.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'">I have reviewed this Annual Report on Form 10-K of</P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; clear:left"><U>International Barrier Technology Inc.</U>;</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; float:left">2.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; float:left">3.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; float:left">4.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; clear:left; float:left">a.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; clear:left; float:left">b.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; clear:left; float:left">c.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; clear:left; float:left">d.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#146;s most recent fiscal quarter that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting; and</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; float:left">5.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#146;s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#146;s Board of Directors:</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; clear:left; float:left">a.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>all significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; clear:left; float:left">b.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'">Date: September 28, 2016</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>

<BODY style="margin-top:0;font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:10pt; color:#000000">
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'"><B>EXHIBIT 32.1</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=center><B>SECTION 1350 CERTIFICATION</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>In connection with the Annual Report of <U>International Barrier Technology Inc.</U> (the &#147;Company&#148;) on Form 10-K for the Fiscal Year ended <U>June 30, 2016</U> as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the &#147;Report&#148;), I, <U>Michael Huddy</U>, Chief Executive Officer of the Company, certify, pursuant to Section 1350 of Chapter 63 of Title 18 of the United States Code, as adopted pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes Oxley Act of 2002, that to the best of my knowledge:</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; float:left">1.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>The Report fully complies with the requirements of Section 13(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; clear:left; float:left">2.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>The information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'">Date: September 28, 2016</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'"><U>/s/ Michael Huddy</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'">Michael Huddy</P>

<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'">(Principal Executive Officer)</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'">__________________________________________________________________________________</P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>This certification is being furnished as required by Rule 13a-14(b) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;) and Section 1350 of Chapter 63 of Title 18 of the United States Code, and shall not be deemed &#147;filed&#148; for purposes of Section 18 of the Exchange Act or otherwise subject to the liability of that Section. &nbsp;This certification shall not be deemed to be incorporated by reference into any filing under the Securities Act of 1933 or the Exchange Act, except as otherwise stated in such filing.</P>
